channel.title: [C4D] Mountain sunrise
channel.description:
I made this a few months ago, stopped using all forums and computer in general though thats why I never posted it.
[img]http://i110.photobucket.com/albums/n94/archerer98/mtscene.jpg[/img]

item.title: [C4D] Mountain sunrise
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

No. They ARE called that, not USUALLY.
It is a very inappropriate name because it’s only made in C4D, just as anything else is.

That’s like me calling a block a 3DSMAX because a lot of new people to 3DSMAX make them first.

They are not usually called that.

If you’re talking about specific 2D graphics communities, sure, there might be a bias of people calling them C4Ds.
But a real graphics community devoted to C4D will not that often be about these shitty abstracts.

YOU call them that because you’re more into Photoshop and you use these abstract renders in your little sigs or whatever the fuck you make. Forums YOU would visit would all be just like YOU and call them that maybe.

But that doesn’t mean they are usually called that. That’s just what you’ve experienced.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Mountain sunrise
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:16, topic:192687”][quote author=ThAt0n36Uy link=topic=256478.msg2136445#msg2136445 date=1206520751]
C4D’s are usually the term used to identify renders of 3D abstract objects, created in the program Cinema 4D. The C4D in his title is just basically identify that he used Cinema 4D, and not PhotoShop, or GIMP.

This is quite basic. But I’m sure if you decided to take it up again. You might be able to learn some new tricks. And possibly extend your knowledge of the program. I suggest modeling objects, over Landscapes.

2/10.
[/quote]

No. They are not “usually” the term for that.

Anyways. It’s not a filter, it’s a shitty environmental effect.[/quote]

Excuse me? Yes they are. You visit the THOUSANDS of Graphics communities, and I’m sure more than 3/4th’s of them would give you the same definition as I did. If I’m wrong, why don’t you at least give an explanation.

EDIT: I did a google image search. And would you imagine that? Only two of them were of designs made in C4D, other than the obvious abstract 3D renders.

http://images.google.com/images?hl=en&q=C4D&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=N&tab=wi

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Mountain sunrise
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:11, topic:192687”]C4D’s are usually the term used to identify renders of 3D abstract objects, created in the program Cinema 4D. The C4D in his title is just basically identify that he used Cinema 4D, and not PhotoShop, or GIMP.

This is quite basic. But I’m sure if you decided to take it up again. You might be able to learn some new tricks. And possibly extend your knowledge of the program. I suggest modeling objects, over Landscapes.

2/10.[/quote]

No. They are not “usually” the term for that.

Anyways. It’s not a filter, it’s a shitty environmental effect.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Mountain sunrise
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

[quote=“ReZZy`, post:14, topic:192687”][quote author=exps35 link=topic=256478.msg2136519#msg2136519 date=1206522824]

Too plain. I would like to see it without all sepia filter. Doesn’t look good with me.

This is not photoshop…
[/quote]
I know, but it still has a filter. It may not be an option but it is still filtered with sepia.[/quote]

just because it has a sepia tone or a color that may look sepia, doesnt mean its done with a filter.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Mountain sunrise
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

C4D’s are usually the term used to identify renders of 3D abstract objects, created in the program Cinema 4D. The C4D in his title is just basically identify that he used Cinema 4D, and not PhotoShop, or GIMP.

This is quite basic. But I’m sure if you decided to take it up again. You might be able to learn some new tricks. And possibly extend your knowledge of the program. I suggest modeling objects, over Landscapes.

2/10.

Read full topic
